item.title: Carol add a quote by Catherine Aird
item.description: "If you can't be a good example, then you'll just have to be a horrible warning." -- Catherine Aird

item.title: Carol add a quote by Rainer Maria Rilke
item.description: "Be patient toward all that is unsolved in your heart and try to love the questions themselves, like locked rooms and like books that are now written in a very foreign tongue. Do not now seek the answers, which cannot be given you because you would not be able to live them. And the point is, to live everything. Live the questions now. Perhaps you will then gradually, without noticing it, live along some distant day into the answer." -- Rainer Maria Rilke

item.title: Carol add a quote by Mother Teresa
item.description: "Not all of us can do great things. But we can do small things with great love." -- Mother Teresa

item.title: Carol add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Outside of a dog, a book is man's best friend. Inside of a dog it's too dark to read." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Carol add a quote by Owens Lee Pomeroy
item.description: "Nostalgia is like a grammar lesson: you find the present tense, and the past perfect!" -- Owens Lee Pomeroy
